title: Bug 10403: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project and points the output folder at a bin directory, the system does not confirm if the bin directory can be deleted and then rebuilt.
EB: When a user creates a new project and points the output folder at a bin directory, the system should confirm if the bin directory can be deleted and then rebuilt.
SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Click on 'Create New Project'.
3. Choose an existing directory structure.
4. Set the output folder to a bin directory.
5. Confirm that the system prompts to delete the bin directory and rebuild it.
